results.title: From Russia with love
results.creator_credit: Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
This second instalment in the Bond genre is considered by many Bond aficionados as possibly the best blend of adventure, action, gadgetry, tongue in cheek nonsense, romance, and the obligatory high tech gadgetry. This time round the evil SPECTRE organisation has hatched a plan to steal a decoder that will access Russian state secrets and irrevocably unbalance the world order. Secret agent 007 is the only man to stand in their way and it’s up to James Bond (Sean Connery) to seize the device first. It won’t be an east task as he must confront enemies that include Red Grant (Robert Shaw) and the ruthless Rosa Klebb (Lotte Lenya), a former KGB agent with poison tipped shoes. Bond is able to access inside information when he begins romancing a stunning Soviet defector (Daniela Bianchi), but he quickly realises that he is being lured into a trap that will require all his wit, charm, ability, and gadgetry to save the day. With the stunning backdrop of Istanbul and Venice, ‘From Russia with love’ features an explosive helicopter attack, a gypsy camp gun battle and a brawl aboard the Orient Express. Cast also includes Pedro Armendariz and Bernard Lee.

results.title: You only live twice
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Lewis Gilbert, Harry Saltzman, EON and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The head of the evil SPECTRE organisation- Ernest Blofeld (Donald Pleasence), has mastermined a plan that could lead to World War 111. He’s using a rocketship to seize manned space missions from Earth’s orbit, causing them to mysteriously disappear. The world’s superpowers, America and Russian- unbeknownst of Blofeld’s plans, suspect one another and as the suspicion mounts, the world teeters on the brink of war. Enter suave, smooth and sophisticated secret agent 007 (Sean Connery) who, accompanied by an attractive Japanese agent Kissy Suzuki (Mie Hama) and scores of Ninja warriors plan a daring attack on Blofeld’s headquarters nestled in an inactive volcano. Screenplay by Roald Dahl and title song performed by Nancy Sinatra. Cast includes Tetsuro Tamba, Akiko Wakabayashi, Karin Dor, Bernard Lee and Desmond Llewellyn.

results.title: Goldfinger
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Guy Hamilton, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
In this non-stop action thriller, Sean Connery is Agent 007 and Gert Frobe is the notorious gold smuggler (appropriately named Goldfinger) who has initiated a cataclysmic scheme to raid Fort Knox and obliterate the world economy. James Bond, armed with his specially equipped Aston Martin and devilish good looks, must stop the plan by overcoming several perilous situations and outrageous adversaries, including Oddjob who kills with a toss of his lethal hat, and the sexy pilot, Pussy Galore, whose romantic feelings for Bond complicate her involvement in Goldfinger’s high-flying scheme. Cast includes: Sean Connery, Gert Frobe, Honor Blackman, Shirley Eaton and Bernard Lee as “M”.

results.title: Goldeneye
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
When a deadly satellite weapon falls into the wrong hands, only Agent 007 (Pierce Brosnan) can save the world from certain disaster. Armed with his license to kill and his smooth talking ways, Bond races to Russia in search of the stolen access codes for “GoldenEye”, the devastating satellite weapon. James Bond is pitted against an enemy who knows his every movement, a former agent, 006, trained in exactly the same methods and who can anticipate his every move. Alec Trevelyan (Sean Bean), agent 006 is motivated by a hatred that goes back years. 006 is not the only person causing Bond grief, he also battles with his former compatriot’s stunning ally, Xenia Onatopp (Famke Janssen), who crushes victims between her shapely but deadly thighs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Campbell, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson and United Artists Corporation

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Pierce Brosnan ignites the screen as the legendary James Bond in this explosive, thrill-packed adventure that hits the bulls-eye for nonstop excitement. When a deadly satellite weapon system falls into the wrong hands, only agent 007 can save the world from certain disaster. Cast includes Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco and Famke Janssen.

results.title: Dr. No
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr. No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist, is a member of the terrorist organisation SPECTRE, which plans to conquer the world. However, thanks to the daring of James Bond, Dr. No is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her screen debut in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme, elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder and the magnificent locations were present from this first film and have now become part of the James Bond legend.

Dr. No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist, is a member of the terrorist organisation SPECTRE, which plans to conquer the world. However, thanks to the daring of James Bond, Dr. No is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her screen debut in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme, elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder and the magnificent locations were present from this first film and have now become part of the James Bond legend.

results.title: 1914 - 1918 The Great War and the Shaping of a Century
results.creator_credit: Carol Sennett, Carl Byker and BBC
results.brief_description: This is a seven part series from the BBC looking at the Great War and the shaping of a century through the words of those who endured it. The series is narrated by Dame Judy Dench. The first part, Explosion, contains the first three episodes and details the build up to the War and the first years of the campaign. The second part, Legacy, expplores the War and the consequences of the end of the War, including the Treaty of Versailles and the seeds that were sown for the second World War.
results.title_for_label: 1914 - 1918 The Great War and the Shaping of a Century

The second part, Legacy, expplores the War and the consequences of the end of the War, including the Treaty of Versailles and the seeds that were sown for the second World War.

results.title: 1914-1918 : legacy
results.creator_credit: Margaret Koval, Imperial War Museum (Great Britain), BBC-TV and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1914 - 1918 The Great War and the Shaping of a Century”.
1914-1918 is a seven part series from the BBC, looking at the Great War and the shaping of a century through the words of those who endured it. With the use of many letters, diaries and film we re-experience a war that involved the people of 5 continents. Narrated by Dame Judi Dench, we also hear voice-overs by Ian Richardson, Martin Landau, Wendy Craig, Tim Pigott-Smith, Chris Fairbank, Jeremy Irons, Liam Neeson, Tom Fleming, John Shrapnel, Malcolm McDowell and Imogen Stubbs reading passages from personal diaries and letters. Many historians including Dr Jay Winter provide valuable background information relating to battles and events which occurred both before, during and after, what became known as The Great War. Tape Two-Legacy contains the last four episodes of this remarkable series. Episode 4-SLAUGHTER, the battles of Verdun, the Somme and Passchendaele were three of the worst of the war, yet soldiers sought to keep their sanity with music, sport and theatre. Episode 5-MUTINY, by the start of 1917, the strain of war was affecting people on the home and battle fronts. Half of the French army mutinied. Episode 6- COLLAPSE, Germany’s war effort collapsed in 1918. Episode 7-LEGACY, the end of WW1 did little to relieve suffering across Europe. Four empires collapsed and large parts of the continent were devastated. The Peace Treaty of Versailles did nothing to ease the suffering of either the conquered or victorious people, and the seeds were sown for a second war. This was a war of attrition of men, machines and ideals. The futility of losing a generation of 9 million men who never came home, from a war many didn’t understand. National honour, fervour, and man’s greed to expand borders and dominate others led to a society which was torn asunder and would never be the same again. It affected and influenced art, music, literature and changed the history for the rest of the 20th Century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Koval, Imperial War Museum (Great Britain), BBC-TV and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)

results.title: 1914-1918 : explosion
results.creator_credit: Margaret Koval, Imperial War Museum (Great Britain), BBC-TV and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1914 - 1918 The Great War and the Shaping of a Century”.
This is a seven part series from the BBC, looking at the Great War and the shaping of a century through the words of those who endured it. With the use of many diaries, letters and film we re-experience a war that involved the people of 5 continents. Narrated by Dame Judy Dench, we also hear voice-overs by Ian Richardson, Martin Landau, Wendy Craig, Tim Pigott-Smith, Chris Fairbanks, Jeremy Irons, Liam Neeson, Tom Fleming, John Shrapnel, Malcolm McDowell and Imogen Stubbs reading passages from personal letters and diaries. Many historians including the series historian Dr. Jay Winter provide valuable background information relating to events and battles which occurred. Tape One-Explosion contains the first three episodes of this remarkable series. Episode 1-EXPLOSION, explores the cultural backdrop to the outbreak of war. Episode 2-STALEMATE, as the war began many experts thought technical advances in weaponry would bring a quick victory but armies resorted to trench warfare on the Western Front. Episode 3-TOTAL WAR, the battle at Gallipoli in 1915 confirmed that European conflict had expanded into the first truly global war. Many Empires and Nations would be forever changed, the social context altered and shattered, a lost generation of men and ideals. Such dramatic events that would shape and define peoples lives for the rest of the 20th Century.
